Define three janus custom elements for a space-based obstacle course game. Make them empty stubs for now, we'll fill in the details as we go.

- spacezone-level
- spacezone-player
- spacezone-obstacle

Added three Janus custom elements: `spacezone-level`, `spacezone-player`, and `spacezone-obstacle` as empty stubs. Let me know if you have specific functionalities to implement or any additional attributes to include.
Add a new component, spacezone-waypoint, which will represent a point on the path our spacecraft will follow within the level
Added the `spacezone-waypoint` component to represent points on the spacecraft's path. Let me know if you need any specific attributes or behaviors for this component.
Make our spacezone-level component look for any spacezone-waypoint children using this.getElementsByTagName('spacezone-waypoint') and store them as this.waypoints

I've updated the `spacezone-level` component to locate all `spacezone-waypoint` child elements and store them in `this.waypoints`. Please review the changes and let me know if you have any additional requirements or suggestions.
Add a placeholder sphere for our waypoint object
Added a placeholder sphere for the `spacezone-waypoint` object. Let me know if you need any specific attributes or behaviors for the sphere.

Use this.createObject('object', { id: 'sphere', ... }) to create our sphere object. Also note that child objects inherit their parent object's position, so no need to specify a position unless it's relative to our parent.

I've updated the `spacezone-waypoint` element to use `this.createObject('object', { id: 'sphere', ... })` for creating the sphere object. The position attribute has been removed since child objects inherit their parent's position.
Don't assign a new vector to our position in the waypoint's create function, it's overriding the position set in the markup

Hello,

I have updated the `spacezone-waypoint` element by removing the assignment of a new vector to `this.position` in the `create` function. This ensures that the position set in the markup is preserved. Please review the changes and let me know if you have any further questions or suggestions.
